intro: Streblus anthropophagorum, commonly known as the human-eating fig, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fig-like fruits that are typically consumed by birds and other animals. It is often found in lowland rainforests and can grow up to 20 meters in height. Despite its ominous common name, it is not known to pose a threat to humans.
